turns.text: Hello my name is Donna and Im calling from Plano Texas
turns.label: fp

turns.text: Hi this is Laurie and Im in Garland
turns.label: fp

turns.text: Oh okay Um would you like me to go first
turns.label: b

turns.text: Okay um I have three children um two two who are in regular school uh eleven year old an eight year old and then my little one three year old is in um University of Gymnastics its preschool --
turns.label: bk

turns.text: -- and um I think it was really hard to um to pick the right uh day care or preschool or Mothers Day Out I guess you can classify them all together
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Um some of the qualifications that I look for was that uh you know the cost and um exactly what they did if it was structured or nonstructured if they had little academic um uh in there and um you know um you know what the qualifications of the teachers were and if the place was clean and --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- um the hours and um just just kind of going by word of mouth and finding out if anybody else has been pleased with their program --
Well we dont have any children but were going to have one next year
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Thanks So um thats something that Im probably going to be looking at --
turns.label: ft

turns.text: -- maybe in the future We havent quite decided if Im going to - Im working part time now and I dont know if Ill be doing that or what were going to do
But if we do then Im going to need to find somebody and our church has Mothers Day Out program --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- which they started last year and we know lot of people at the church so I would feel very confident with leaving --
Thats very good place to start I think
turns.label: sv

turns.text: uh-huh Yeah the Mothers Day Out programs and thats where Shannon had started in Mothers Day Out program --
turns.label: aa

turns.text: -- and uh the churches always have I think pretty good program and you have to make sure that you um that you apply pretty early because they do have lot of places have very long waiting lists
turns.label: sv

turns.text: And um and another question to ask is if theyre um state certified --
turns.label: ad

turns.text: -- um you know if the teachers have um their Masters degree in in child education and --
-- um child development Um you know what what kind of structure is it going to be Um when your childs little bit older like three year old --
-- youd be more concerned with if theres type of care that its torture for them to lay down and take nap Is there like mandatory nap time

What they do at Shannons school is have video tape going and if and they lay on these little mats and if they fall asleep they kind of let them sleep and the teacher stays with the sleeping ones and the other ones get up and go do something else
turns.label: sd

turns.text: So she doesnt have to necessary take nap there --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- you know which is which is nice Um
uh-huh Um you know its kind of scary I guess because you hear so many bad things about day cares --
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- lately and so its I guess its such growing concern but then theres lot of good things you dont hear

Right And sometimes when the childs lot younger before theyre really um before three years old you know like the church is good program and sometimes you even consider um you know having private person come to your own home when theyre real little or --
turns.label: aa

turns.text: -- or something like that and another consideration is how many infants or children are they whats the ratio of of teachers to --
-- because that makes difference and if your child would be maybe sleeping in that crib all day - just your child and or do they just put any child in any crib --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- you know - you would want maybe your child to have their own sheets all the time and not have another --
-- you know Im sure that um whatever you decide youll be happy with
And its exciting time to have new one
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Yeah but that you know we have been thinking about that but its little ways off in the future --
turns.label: aa

turns.text: -- but um I figure you know Id probably start asking --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- because I know they have limit as to how old they can be before they you know before you can bring them in
Some some places um start them as early as I think well some some places take them as infants I guess you know like eight weeks even
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Um theres place to look into um um friend of mine whos nurse is was telling about wonderful new place that opened some place in on Fifteenth Street up - its in Plano somewhere where um nurses that used to work in the hospital take care of infants infants and then only up to like two years old --
turns.label: ad

turns.text: -- and its its supposed to be really - you know some places just specialize in just real little ones --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- and then other ones uh are the older children
turns.label: sd

turns.text: But it is difficult situation I think When theyre when theyre little its almost easier to leave them because when theyre three and theyre cry -
